content.description: Sit start on the obvious weakness in the wide, low horizontal. Then complete an engaging and enjoyable V3 boulder problem to gain the slopers at the lip. For full-credit, thrutch through the mantle for which the route is named.
content.location: When facing Ready Fire Aim, walk downhill (climber's left) in a sweeping arc to find the wall of Whale and Moan.

content.description:
The Vortex Traverse follows horizontal cracks in the scooped wall on the far right of the main area.  

  Start sitting down and left. Use hand holds in the cracks and terrible footholds as you traverse right across the scoop. When you reach cool, smooth, slopey holds toward the end, throw your right foot up and topout on the mini slab.

Ready Fire Aim climbs the conspicuous outside corner that sits at the center of the After Work Boulders. Start with your right hand on a decomposing sidepull crimp and your left hand on the corner. Make a quick move to a good hold on the corner, match the hold, and fire to the lip.  

  Given its striking line, its fun moves, and its easy access, Ready Fire Aim is destined to become a Waterville classic.
content.protection: Pads. You probably want at least two, as falls can deposit the climber on either the left side or the right side of the corner.

content.description: This is a sit-start to the already established Cool But Contrived. Start sitting  with your left hand on an OK crimp and your right hang on a bad crimp. Pull up, go right hand to another bad crimp, and pop right hand to the starting hold of the stand version of Cool But Contrived. Top out as per Cool But Contrived.

Cool but Contrived climbs a face just left of a short crack. Start standing with your right hand on a hold just left of the crack. Move left hand to a small gaston and then move your right hand to a hidden crystal on the sloping lip. Make a fun move up around the lip to a hidden dish up and left, and negotiate a sloping topout.  

  If the crack on the right wasn't so close, this problem would gain a few more stars.

The After Work Boulders offer the most accessible climbing in the Waterville Region. This area is not extensive or amazing, but if you're looking for a quick workout, this spot is worth checking out. One problem (Ready Fire Aim) stands out as classic, but there's still potential for some fill-ins that would create a nice little circuit.
